column1: Tom Ford: ‘I Believe in Fashion, Absolutely’
column3: Tim Blanks sits down with the American designer to discuss cancel culture, turning 60, mortality and the future of the Tom Ford brand, courtesy of ES Magazine.

column1: Dover Street Market Aims to Reinvent Retail (Again)
column3: Comme des Garçons’ chain of luxury bazaars reimagined multi-brand retail. Now, CEO Adrian Joffe is aiming to do it again with radical events platform 3537.

column1: Ian Rogers: ‘Five years from now, we will have closets where we share our digital collections’
column3: Ledger’s chief experience officer explains how — and when — fashion should tap into the NFT gold rush, as featured in the fourth episode of The BoF Show, now streaming on Bloomberg Quicktake.

column1: Peru’s Biggest Fashion Trade Shows Push Appeal of Alpaca Products
column3: Peru Moda Deco and Alpaca Fiesta, Peru’s most important fashion and textile trade shows, closed on Friday after several weeks of digital events bringing together all links in the textile and alpaca value chains.

column1: How to Leverage Livestreaming
column3: A panel of experts discuss the keys to making sales through real-time video streaming, a trend expanding beyond China as new technologies spread around the world.

column1: Following Investment, M&S Launches on Rental Platform Hirestreet
column3: It makes M&S the first major high street retailer in the UK to signal broader ambitions in the burgeoning clothing rental market.

column1: Nike Delays Its Travis Scott Sneaker Release After Astroworld Concert Tragedy
column3: Nike Inc. said it would postpone the release of a sneaker collaboration with rapper Travis Scott’s Cactus Jack label after a crowd crush resulted in the deaths of 10 people at his concert earlier this month.

column1: African E-commerce Company Jumia’s Users Grow, Losses Deepen
column3: Africa’s Jumia Technologies on Tuesday reported an 8 percent increase in active customers in its third quarter to the end of September from a year earlier, following a ramp-up in marketing efforts, but said its adjusted loss had nearly doubled.

column1: The $12 Billion Start-Up Proving Wholesale Is Thriving
column3: A $400 million investment in Faire, which pairs brands with retailers, is a sign of how multi-brand stores are here to stay after a decade where direct-to-consumer brands dominated the conversation.

column1: Should Fashion Consider Same-Day Delivery?
column3: Ulta and Abercrombie & Fitch are the latest retailers to offer shoppers ultra-fast delivery through partnerships with courier companies. While the service isn’t yet industry table stakes, experts say it’s an effective tool for driving loyalty.

column1: Hanifa’s Washington Debut
column3: The brand known for pioneering virtual fashion finally met its audience in real life, giving a glimpse into designer Anifa Mvuemba’s long term ambitions.

column1: India’s Online Fashion Leader Launches Myntra Luxe
column3: India’s leading fashion e-commerce platform player, Myntra, is expanding its reach into the luxury segment, launching a dedicated store for high-end brands on its app called Myntra Luxe.

column1: At Klarna, A New Customer Acquisition Channel for Retailers
column3: “I believe we’re becoming a very viable marketing alternative to the Facebook and Google networks,” says Klarna chief marketing officer David Sandstrom. Here, he shares why the payments company is investing heavily in its retailer support offerings and what it means for brands.

column1: For Cartier, Love Is a Battlefield
column3: With Tiffany’s LVMH-backed reboot making a splash, Cartier is trying to hit back with its own holiday push. Here’s what the campaign says about the Paris-based jewellery giant’s strategy.

column1: Why Effeminate Men Have Been Banned in China
column3: The government’s recent ban on so-called “sissy men” in the media could have far-reaching implications for China’s fashion community and global brands operating there.

column1: Olaplex Sales Up 80 Percent in First Quarterly Earnings
column3: The hair products maker — which fetched a valuation of more than $13.6 billion in an upsized initial public offering on Sept. 30 — posted net sales of $161.6 million and almost doubled its net income, at $56.6 million.

column1: Chen Man Photo at Dior’s Shanghai Exhibit Sparks Heated Online Debate
column3: A photograph from one of China’s most famous fashion photographers, Chen Man, featured as part of a Christian Dior exhibition in Shanghai has drawn the ire of state media on Monday.

column1: Beauty Brands’ Newest Exit Strategy
column3: A new wave of deals in beauty show there are future paths beyond an acquisition from Estée Lauder or L’Oréal.

column1: Vanity Fair’s European Editions Align Following Consolidation
column3: In another example of how Condé Nast’s content has changed now that each publication has single regional and global editors, the Italian, French and Spanish editions of Vanity Fair announced a shared theme for its upcoming editions.

column1: Chen Man Photo at Dior’s Shanghai Exhibit Sparks Online Debate
column3: A photograph from one of China’s most famous fashion photographers, Chen Man, featured as part of a Christian Dior exhibition in Shanghai has drawn the ire of state media on Monday.

column1: Louis Vuitton Brings Spring/Summer Show to Shanghai
column3: Shanghai’s shipyard repair docks were transformed on Wednesday evening, adorned with 1,800 custom-made chandeliers in order to serve as the backdrop of the latest outing for Louis Vuitton’s Spring/Summer 2022 collection.

column1: Gabriela Hearst in Conversation with Tim Blanks
column3: The Chloé creative director speaks with Tim Blanks about desirability, sustainability and fashion’s future.

column3: Explore the core themes and reserve your spot to attend BoF’s annual gathering for big thinkers.

column1: Coty Invests in Prestige Skin Care Brand Orveda as It Aims to Grow Both Categories
column3: Coty is continuing its prioritisation of prestige with an investment in Orveda, a skin care label known for its vegan, genderless offering and microbiome and prebiotics focus.

column1: Why Jewellery’s Diversity Problem Is So Hard to Fix
column3: The industry is reckoning with a lack of opportunities for Black designers. But change comes slow in a world where money and connections often determine who has access to precious stones.

column1: In New York, BoF and Shopify Host Forum on Retail’s New Paradigm
column3: Industry leaders gathered to discuss the challenges and opportunities native-app commerce represents as retail shifts from mobile browsing to in-app purchases, before calling for closer ties within the American fashion community to navigate disruption and support young talent.

column1: China’s Top Livestreaming Sales Stars in Dispute With L’Oréal
column3: China’s top two livestreaming sales stars said they have suspended cooperation with French cosmetics giant L’Oreal over a dispute about prices during Alibaba Group’s Singles Day shopping promotion earlier this month.

column1: Perfect Diary Parent Reports Slight Revenue Increase, $100 Million Share Buyback
column3: Yatsen Holdings, the Chinese beauty conglomerate which owns brands including Perfect Diary, Abby’s Choice, Eve Lom and Galénic, reported net revenues for its third quarter, ending Sept. 30, of 1.34 billion yuan ($208.4 million), a year-on-year increase of 6 percent.

column1: Russian Retailer Familia Sees Revenue Grow By Almost 50%
column3: Russian off-price retailer, Familia, increased its revenue by 47.8 percent in the first nine months of 2021 compared to the same period last year and by 30.6 percent compared to pre-pandemic levels in the first nine months of 2019. Revenue for the period reached 24.9 billion roubles ($342 million).

column1: How Brandon Blackwood Avoided Being a One-Hit Wonder
column3: The designer, whose viral End Systemic Racism bags helped him build a cult following, is now turning his attention to building a full-fledged brand beyond his signature totes.

column1: Power Moves | Bottega Veneta’s New Creative Director; Versace’s Interim CEO
column3: Mattheiu Blazy will succeed Daniel Lee, and Cedric Wilmote will helm Versace as it searches for Jonathan Akeroyd’s permanent successor.

column1: Farfetch Shares Plunge in After-Hours Trading on Revenue Miss
column3: Shares were down 24 percent in after-hours trading, after the luxury marketplace reported a 33 percent increase in revenue to $583 million in the three months ending September 20, 2021, short of the average analyst forecast for $591 million.

column1: Oprah and Reese Witherspoon Invest in Spanx at $1.2 Billion Valuation
column3: Oprah Winfrey and the actress Reese Witherspoon were among new investors in Spanx Inc. as the womenswear brand completed a majority sale to funds managed by Blackstone Inc.

column1: Macy’s Says It Is Working With Alixpartners to Review Its Business Structure
column3: Macy’s Inc said on Thursday it is working with consulting firm AlixPartners to review its business structure, just a month after activist investor Jana Partners urged the department store chain to sell its e-commerce business.

column1: At Columbia College Chicago, a Return to Hands-On Learning
column3: The creative and liberal arts college’s curriculum is rooted in hands-on learning, immersive experiences and their diversity, equity and inclusion mission. The chair of fashion studies shares insights alongside faculty and students.

column1: Patrizio Bertelli on Prada’s Next Chapter
column3: After a lengthy turnaround, CEO Patrizio Bertelli outlines his growth plans for the Milanese fashion giant.
